document_data.caption: A ''manual of stone golems''.
document_data.name: ''Manual of Golems''
document_data.value3e: {{Split table|rca=right|Clay golem|24,000 gp|Flesh golem|24,000 gp|Iron golem|10,500 gp|Stone golem|9,500 gp}}
document_data.mainbody: A '''''manual of golems''''' was a [[book]] that contained instructions on how to construct a specific type of [[golem]].
document_data.Description: In order to read a ''manual of golems'', the reader needed to be a reasonably accomplished spellcaster. Individuals unable to read the manual who attempted to do so risked damaging their own psyche.
document_data.Powers: Constructing the golem was an arduous job that required several days to complete and only allowed for small resting periods. Once all the instructions were followed, the manual burst into flames and burned to ashes. Sprinkling those ashes on the newly constructed golem brought it to life, under the control of its builder.
document_data.Notable Owners: [[Withers]], an [[undead]] servant of [[Acererak]] charged with maintaining the [[Tomb of the Nine Gods]] in good repair, owned a ''manual of clay golems''.
